author: cbs8
title: Greater Baltimore Committee's Transportation Summit to Focus on Improving U.S. Highway Infrastructure
text:
Greater Baltimore Committee
BALTIMORE , Sept. 25, 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- The following is being released by the Greater Baltimore Committee
WHO:
Keynote speaker : United States Senator Ben Cardin
Panelists : Jack Schenendorf, former chief of staff for the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the United States House of Representatives; Kathryn Ruffalo, former senior adviser to the United States Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works who reported directly to the committee chairman; Kellie Mejdrich, reporter, CQ Roll Call ; and Jennifer Scholtes, reporter, Politico Pro .
WHAT:
2015 GBC Transportation Summit
WHEN:
Monday, September 28, 2015
7:30 a.m. registration/breakfast
8 a.m. program
WHERE:
Renaissance Baltimore Harborplace Hotel, 202 E. Pratt St., Baltimore, MD 21202
DETAILS:
The 2015 GBC Transportation Summit will focus on "What's Next – How Do We Move Forward with America's Infrastructure?"
The United States' transportation infrastructure is decaying. Once the finest in the world, our country's roads, bridges and railroads now rank a dismal 16th – well behind financially strapped countries like Spain and Portugal . What happened and how can we fix it?
Join us for this year's GBC Transportation Summit where we will discuss the fate of the federal transportation authorization. What do we need to do and where will we find the funds to regain a world-class transportation infrastructure?
